# Methods and Theory {.center}

## Molecular dynamics / Molecular Mechanics

:::{layout="[1,2,2]"}
![](./img/propionaldehyde.svg)

![](./img/molecule-cpk.png)

![](./img/molecule-density.png)
:::

How do we make the atoms move?

$$
\begin{array}{rcl}
F  &=& ma \\
-\frac{dV}{dr} &=& m\frac{d^2r}{dt^2},
\end{array}
$${#eq-newton}

$V$: potential\
$r$: position\
$F$: force\
$a$: acceleration\
$t$: time\
$m$: mass

## Applying KIMMDY to collagen [hydrolysis]{.blue} and [homolysis]{.red}

:::: {layout="[1,0.2,1]"}
:::d
Arrhenius equation

$$
k = A\,\mathrm{e}^{\left(\frac{-E_\mathrm{a}}{RT}\right)}
$${#eq-arrhenius}

$A$: pre-exponential factor (attempt frequency)\
$R$: gas constant \
$T$: temperature

![](./img/morse-potential.png){width=500px}

$$V_{morse}(r) = D \left(1 - e^{-\beta(r - r_0)}\right)^2$${#eq-energy-morse}
:::

:::d
:::

:::d
**Homolysis**

Benedikt Rennekamp [@rennekampHybridKineticMonte2020],\
Bell-Evans model [@bellModelsSpecificAdhesion1978;@evansDynamicStrengthMolecular1997].

**Hydrolysis**

Same force calculation with a twist
:::

## Hydrolysis rate incorporates pH, SASA and force

:::{layout="[[7,3,3]]"}
![](./figures/hyd/crosslinks-wide.png)

![](./figures/render-chain-c-tubes-cpk-cropped.png){}

![](./figures/render-triple-tubes-cpk-cropped.png){}
:::


$$
\mathrm{Rate}(bond, t) = \
\frac{\mathrm{SASA}(bond, t)}{\mathrm{SASA}_{max}} \cdot \
\frac{c_{OH^-}}{c_{OH^-_{\mathrm{exp}}}} \
\cdot \mathrm{rate}_{\mathrm{exp}}(F_{bond,t})
$${#eq-hydrolysis-rate}

:::{.absolute bottom=0 left=50% width=25%}

## Discussion and outlook

- **pH** just a factor, could be e.g. constant pH simulations [@ahoScalableConstantPH2022]
- **SASA** influence **likely** to be **underestimated**
- Need a link to real tissue **experiments**
